marketNews.title: Nickel Prices Continue to Fall, Global Producers Shaken
marketNews.content: The prolonged decline in nickel prices is beginning to have a negative impact on global nickel producers, especially in Australia. Some producers have decided to temporarily close their mines, while others have announced they will re-evaluate their projects. Wyloo Metals announced it will temporarily shut down its Kambalda nickel mine in Australia at the end of May 2024 due to low nickel prices, just six months after acquiring the mine for USD 760 million. BHP is re-evaluating its nickel business and may postpone a USD 1.2 billion nickel project in West Musgrave, Australia, while seeking options to mitigate the sharp price drop; further details are expected in its mid-year report on 20 February 2024. First Quantum Minerals will cut staff and production at its Ravensthorpe mine in Australia because of a significant nickel price decline. As of 22 January 2024, nickel prices have fallen 44.64 % year-on-year to USD 15,799 per tonne, pressured by a surge in supply from Indonesia, the world’s largest producer. The International Nickel Study Group projects global nickel surplus to widen from 223,000 tonnes in 2023 to 239,000 tonnes in 2024. BloombergNEF analyst Allan Ray Restauro said Indonesian nickel projects are more flexible in absorbing the price drop due to low labor costs, cheap energy and abundant raw materials. Citigroup forecasts nickel prices to fall to USD 15,500 per tonne in three months, while ING Group projects an average price of USD 16,813 per tonne for the full year 2024. Key takeaway: the expected continued pressure on nickel prices will challenge the profitability of nickel mining companies, favoring those with efficient operations and low-cost structures.

marketNews.title: What To Watch For
marketNews.content: Upcoming economic data releases for the week of 22-26 January 2024: Monday (22/1): Indonesia M2 Money Supply YoY December (3.5 %, November: 3.3 %). Tuesday (23/1): Bank of Japan interest rate (consensus: -0.1 %, December: -0.1 %). Wednesday (24/1): Indonesia Foreign Direct Investment YoY Q4 2023 (November: 16.2 %). Thursday (25/1): US Q4 2023 GDP QoQ growth (consensus: 2 % vs. Q3 2023: 4.9 %). Friday (26/1): US Personal Income MoM December (consensus: 0.3 % vs. November: 0.4 %). Friday (26/1): US Personal Spending MoM December (consensus: 0.4 % vs. November: 0.2 %).

marketNews.title: Economic Data Released Last Week
marketNews.content: Indonesia: December trade balance (USD 3.3 billion vs. November USD 2.41 billion). Indonesia: Bank Indonesia policy rate (6 % vs. November 6 %). Indonesia: Credit growth YoY December (10.38 % vs. November 9.74 %). Indonesia: M2 Money Supply YoY December (3.5 % vs. November 3.3 %). China: Q4 2023 GDP YoY (5.2 % vs. Q3 2023 4.9 %). China: December house price index YoY (-0.4 % vs. November -0.2 %). China: December industrial production YoY (6.8 % vs. November 6.6 %). China: December retail sales YoY (7.4 % vs. November 10.1 %). China: December unemployment rate YoY (5.1 % vs. November 5 %). US: December retail sales YoY (5.6 % vs. November 4 %).

marketNews.title: China's Coal Imports from Indonesia Reach Record Levels
marketNews.content: China imported 220.25 million tonnes of Indonesian coal in 2023, a 29 % YoY increase, accounting for 46.42 % of China's total coal imports. During 2023, China imported a total of 474.42 million tonnes of coal, a 61.8 % YoY rise and a record high. Coal imports from Australia grew 18-fold to 52.47 million tonnes after the lifting of the Australian coal import ban in January 2023, but remain 32.3 % below the 2020 level when the ban was not in place.

marketNews.title: IKN Investment Commitment Realization 2023
marketNews.content: Deputy for Financing and Investment of the IKN Authority, Agung Wicaksono, said that the realization of investment commitments in IKN during 2023 reached IDR 41.4 trillion, below the target of IDR 45 trillion. The shortfall was due to the postponement of groundbreaking for several projects because of the Christmas and New Year holidays. Agung is optimistic that 2024 investment realization will exceed 2023, as most of the 2023 investments only began in September-December 2023.

marketNews.title: Retail Business Growth Outlook 2024
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Retail Entrepreneurs Association (Aprindo), Roy Nicholas Mandey, is optimistic that retail business growth in 2024 will be around +3.7-3.8 % YoY, driven by political party consumption during the election period. He also mentioned that the main drivers of growth are household consumption and government spending.

marketNews.title: Political Polls Show Rising Electability of Prabowo Subianto
marketNews.content: The latest Indonesian Political Indicator survey found Prabowo Subianto's electability rising to 48.6 % from 45.8 % in the previous survey. The Lembaga Survei Indonesia also reported Prabowo's electability at 47 % up from 45.6 %. Last week, Indonesia Polling Stations recorded Prabowo's electability at 51.8 % after the third debate.

Link Net Plans Fiber Business Divestiture up to Rp7.8 Trillion, 2x Market Cap
tickerNews.content: Link Net is considering selling a stake in its fiber business worth USD 400-500 million (IDR 6.3-7.8 trillion) to fund fiber build-out. The valuation is about 77-119 % higher than Link's market cap of IDR 3.56 trillion as of Monday 22 January. A spokesperson for Axiata Group Bhd said the corporate action is still in early consideration and Link may decide not to proceed. Link declined to comment. In December 2023, Link agreed to transfer 750,000 business fixed-broadband customers to XL Axiata (EXCL).

tickerNews.title: Hartadinata Abadi signs MoU to export 1,920 kg gold in 2024
tickerNews.content: Hartadinata Abadi signed a memorandum of understanding with Indian company RKD Solutions to export 1,920 kg of gold from 17 January to 31 December 2024. The total transaction value is USD 113.51 million (IDR 1.77 trillion).

tickerNews.title: Artha Kencana Rayatama purchases 22.76 million AKRA shares
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of AKR Corporindo, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, bought 22.76 million AKRA shares at an average price of IDR 1,602 per share between 12-18 January 2024, for a total value of approximately IDR 36.47 billion. After the transaction, PT Arthakencana Rayatama's ownership in AKRA increased from 60.22 % to 60.33 %.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors' subsidiary forms joint venture PT Jabar Environmental Solutions
tickerNews.content: United Tractors, through its subsidiary PT Energia Prima Nusantara (EPN), established a joint venture with Sumitomo Corporation (SC) and Hitachi Zosen Corporation (HITZ) named PT Jabar Environmental Solutions (JES). JES will operate power generation, waste treatment and non-hazardous waste disposal. The venture's paid-in capital is IDR 10 trillion, with ownership of 30 % by EPN, 60 % by SC and 10 % by HITZ.

tickerNews.title: Tower Bersama Infrastructure issues 2.7 trillion rupiah bond
tickerNews.content: Tower Bersama Infrastructure will issue a bond worth IDR 2.7 trillion with a 6.75 % coupon and a tenor of 370 days. The proceeds will be used to redeem bonds maturing on 17 February and 27 February 2024. The bond received an idAA+ rating from Pefindo.

tickerNews.title: Wijaya Karya records new contract worth 29.1 trillion rupiah in 2023
tickerNews.content: Wijaya Karya recorded a new contract value of IDR 29.1 trillion for 2023, exceeding the target range of IDR 25-27 trillion by 107.8-116.4 % but down 12.7 % YoY. Since 2Q23, WIKA has entered a standstill phase and a restructuring process.
